question.questionText: Paula wants to test a food to see if it contains acid and/or sugar. When Paula added water and yeast to a sample of the food and put the mixture in a warm water bath, the mixture began to fizz and bubble. Paula tested for the other substance. What would the test results tell her?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: If gas (carbon dioxide) is produced, the food contains acid. If no gas is produced, the food does not contain acid.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: What amount of sugar and acid that is in the food.
If the syringe goes up and if it bubbles that means it has acid.
Well if it has a lot of volume it has sugar and if the syringe goes all the way up it has acid.
That the food contains acid and sugar.
